title: PHPis_executable()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPis_executable()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Check whether the specified filename is executable:
<?php
$file = "setup.exe";
if(is_executable($file)) {
echo ("$file is executable");
}
else {
echo ("$file is not executable");
}
?>
The output of the code above could be:
setup.exe is executable
Definition and Usage
The is_executable() function checks whether the specified filename is executable.
Note:
The result of this function is cached. Use
clearstatcache()
to 
clear the cache.
Syntax
is_executable(
file
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
file
Required. Specifies the path to the file to check
Technical Details
Return Value:
TRUE if the file is executable, FALSE and an E_WARNING on 
 failure
PHP Version:
4.0+

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers PHPis_executable()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPis_executable()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPis_executable()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
